name: sluagh

attributes.attribute: Ghosts or souls of those who had died without being forgiven for earthly transgressions
trapped in this world and could not move on to the Otherworld
could never travel in daylight, being forced to reside always in gloomy night
waged endless war upon each other, leaving stripes of their blood behind each morning

sources: Monaghan, Patricia. The Encyclopedia of Celtic Mythology and Folklore. Checkmark Books, 2008.
text: Scottish folklore recounts tales of the sluagh, a group of spectral entities known as the "Host of the Unforgiven Dead." Unlike Fairies, their appearances were confined to the dark hours, as they were the restless spirits of individuals who had committed transgressions during their time on Earth and were therefore unable to enter the Otherworld. Trapped in our realm, they remained unable to travel during day time or leave the darkness of night. The sluagh engaged in constant battles that left trails of blood every morning.
